content: Family General Asked by Kenneth LouAsked on 08 Oct 2018What are some of the under-appreciated jobs you see around you in your daily life?Last week there was this CNA Insider documentary which shared about the story of foreign workers, construction workers and cleaners who wrote little letters about their lives and how they were 'Invisible'. Do share with us some of your own experiences you have come across in your daily lives.7 answersAnswerBump1

Kenneth Lou, Co-founder at SeedlyLevel 8. WizardUpdated on 07 Jun 2019For me it's the security guard whom I meet everyday... He always looks so fierce, but I think it could be a vicious cycle:He feels under appreciated (invisible)He has to scold people (even residents) and make his voice heardPeople treat him badlyHe feels even more under appreciatedJust a random thought. Next time I see him, I'm planning to buy him a Putu Piring. To brighten his day. Let's see how that goes :) will update on this story when it happens. 4 comments7

Leong Wen Fong, Economics and Management at University of LondonLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 09 Oct 2018I think policemen can be fairly under appreciated. There are those who genuinely join the force because they want to protect the law an dorder of the country, but soemtimes they are seen as being inflexible, or "ruining the fun". ​To be the one that breaks the party can be a real bummer, and I'm sur ethey would love to have everyone having fun, but the law that they enforce and help to keep also plays a part in the everyday security of Singapore.​Sometimes it's the black sheep amongst a community or a profession that dirties the flock.0 comments2
